response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: You can use the Iterator.next() method to retrieve the next value from the iterator. However, since you are using Hibernate, you can also use the 'nextResult()' method to retrieve the next result from the query.

Here's an example:
```vbnet
List<StudentObj> stObj = StudentDAO.getRows();
Iterator<StudentObj> it = stObj.iterator();
while (it.hasNext()) {
    StudentObj s = it.next();
    //Do something with s
}

//Alternatively
List<StudentObj> stObj = StudentDAO.getRows();
StudentObj s = stObj.get(0);
//Do something with s
```
<<<explanation>>>: By using the Iterator.next() method, you will retrieve the first value from the iterator in each iteration of the loop. Instead, you can use the 'nextResult()' method to retrieve the next result from the query, allowing you to work on different rows in concurrent calls to your API.
